title: 'Today' Show anchor Hoda Kotb a first-time mom at age 52
text:
'Today' Show anchor Hoda Kotb a first-time mom at age 52 1 / 13 Back to Gallery 
A Daytime Emmy winning anchor of the Today Show shared some thrilling news via Twitter. 
Hoda Kotb, tweeted a photo of her holding her new daughter while flashing a huge smile. The photo was captioned, "My girl" followed by three hearts emojis accompanied by the sweetest hashtag, "#HaleyJoyKotb". 
Kotb adopted Haley on Monday and revealed some details about the baby's birth date on a call to her co-anchor friends at the Today show "She's a Valentine's baby so she's a little nugget... She is the love of my life!" 
We can feel the inspiration behind Haley's middle name. 
This is the first child for Kotb, 52. 
(Story continues below.) 
"Today" show host Hoda Kotb had some very special news to share with fans: she just adopted a baby girl! The show host has been missing from her "Today" show duties. She recently called in to her co-hosts and told her friends and fans the good news. Her daughter, Haley Joy, was born on Valentines day. Matt Lauer called her new baby the "luckiest" girl on the planet, and said he knows Kotb will make "one of the fantastic moms" he can imagine. Media: Brandpoint 
She was married to Burzis Kanga from 2005 to 2007, But the anchor has reportedly moved in with her boyfriend since 2013, Joel Schiffman. 
Kotb's co-hosts equally shared their joy on social media. 
Kathie Lee Gifford tweeted, "So thrilled for @hodakotb and her precious daughter, Haley Joy!! She will be the best mommy ever! We love you, Hoda, enjoy every moment!" 
Jenna Bush Hager tweeted ," Can't. Stop. Crying. So thrilled for you , @hodakotb. Haley Joy's life will be defined by *JOY* with you as a mama. Love!" 
And Savannah Guthrie tweeted , "Overjoyed for @hodakotb and her little comet Haley - a brilliant flash of light for our world. Love love love and LOVE" 
Congratulations to the new mom!
